conclusion: A sphere (A) is falling from above onto a flat surface where several blocks are placed.
The blocks are arranged in groups of two, with different colors (green, orange, and blue).

The image shows a green surface with blocks arranged in pairs: green blocks on the left, orange blocks in the middle, blue blocks next to the orange blocks, and yellow blocks on the right. Sphere A is falling towards the yellow blocks.
Sphere A will first collide with the top block of the yellow blocks on the right.
The collision will transfer some energy from the sphere to the yellow block, causing the block to move or shift.
After colliding with the yellow block, sphere A will likely continue its downward motion due to gravity.
Sphere A may deflect slightly depending on the angle and force of the initial collision.
Given the position and the direction of the arrow, sphere A is likely to move towards the orange blocks after deflecting off the yellow blocks.
Sphere A will continue moving until it reaches the orange blocks.
Sphere A may collide with one or both of the orange blocks, depending on the force and direction of its movement after the first collision.
Sphere A will eventually come to rest near or on top of the orange blocks, depending on the energy dissipated during collisions.
Sphere A will collide with the yellow blocks first, then likely move towards and collide with the orange blocks, finally coming to rest near or on top of the orange blocks.
